intro: Brachyglottis bellidioides var. bellidioides, commonly known as the New Zealand bellidiopsis, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance. This variety is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
